p: We calculated 95% confidence intervals for each ΔVE by bootstrap, using 1,000 resamples (see the Web Appendix, available at https://academic.oup.com/aje). We excluded studies with large uncertainty, as defined by a 95% confidence interval range for VE FLU− of more than 100 percentage points. The remaining studies were pooled, and estimates of ΔVE FLU−,ORV+, ΔVE FLU−,PAN−, and ΔVE ORV+,PAN− against influenza A or B were calculated. Where studies provided both overall estimates and estimates for subgroups, we removed the overall estimate to avoid any overlap. We performed Egger’s test on ΔVE FLU−,ORV+ and its standard error to assess publication bias. A fixed-effects model was assumed, and heterogeneity was examined by means of the I 2 statistic and Cochran’s Q test. The inverse of the variance of ΔVE FLU−,ORV+ was used to weight the studies.
